All this He deemed of small account in view of the results that He was working out, in behalf, not only of the inhabitants of this speck of a world, but of the whole universe--every world that God had created. All this humility of the Majesty of Heaven was for guilty, condemned man. He went lower and lower in His humiliation until there was no lower depth that He could reach, in order to lift man up from his moral degradation.--Ms. 141, 1901. 

Ellen G. White Estate Washington, D. C. Sept. 3, 1987. Entire Manuscript.
